segments.text: I see a woman standing at the sink, completely absorbed in drying a plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn’t even notice the water overflowing onto the floor, forming a puddle around her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the water, but she just keeps polishing that plate like nothing’s wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s even aware of the mess she’s standing in.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is just pouring out water, and she’s acting like it’s a normal day.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe she hasn’t turned off the faucet yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are sneaking cookies, and she’s completely oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is just chaotic, and she’s the only one not reacting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone turns off that water before the whole kitchen floods.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, but inside, it’s a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR
